name: Hot Clam Spread
ingredients: 2 cans minced clams and their juice
1 Can (10 OZ.) Hungry Jack Flaking Biscuits
1 small to medium red onion chopped
1 Small Jar Jalapeno Peppers chopped (use more or less – depends on how hot you like it)
instructions: Simmer the clams and lemon juice for 15 minutes
In a separate pan, simmer the rest of the ingredients
Combine both mixtures and add ½ cup flavored bread crumbs
Put in baking dish, top with American cheese
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika
Freezes well. Freeze without cheese topping until ready to use
SUSAN LAGARCE’S TOMATO BACON CUPS aka Aunt Michelle’s Fat Cups
Coarsely chop bacon, tomato and onion
Mix all other ingredients together expect biscuits and set aside
Spray Mini Muffin tin with cooking spray
Separate each biscuit into 3 thinner biscuits
Place in muffin tin, pressing biscuit along inside of tin
Brown ground chuck and then pour off the grease. This is purely a consideration for the consistency of the dip and should in no way be construed as a fat saving measure.
Dump in a bunch of the taco seasoning, hot picante sauce and hot cheese whiz. It’s sort of like a fancy ro-tel dip, only hotter and more fattening, on account of the beef.

This stuff is great on Fritos and or scoopable Tostito’s, as long as they are not the low fat baked variety. We are against those. This combo is so hot and so salty that you will quickly need lots of Margaritas.
Heat oil, vinegar and sugar until sugar is dissolved
Pour over all other ingredients and stir
Put in refrigerator and let marinade until cool
